result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Victim Identification Key filed by DA Hatch
The original document was titled: Victim Identification Key
The original history event date is: 10-03-2022

Defendant must report to the Pierce County Day Report Center for fingerprints and photograph. 
No Contact Whatsoever with A.J.J.

9:55 AM Defendant Justin S. Judkins appears in Court, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Walker is requesting a $2,500.00 signature bond w/conditions of No Contact w/A.J.J., no objection. Court so orders. DE waives time limits.  Court adjourned at 9:58 am.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on November 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
